FuncDef:
The aps anti-replay enable command enables APS anti-replay.
The undo aps anti-replay enable command disables APS anti-replay.
By default, APS anti-replay is disabled.
Examples: Warning: Check that the command is also configured on the peer end. If not, the E-APS function will fail to work. Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In dual-device APS scenarios, PGP is used to exchange control information between devices. To prevent PGP packets from being frequently attacked, run the aps anti-replay enable command to enable APS anti-replay. When APS anti-replay is enabled, the HMAC algorithm is used for PGP authentication strings to improve dual-device APS PGP communication security.
Prerequisites
An interface has been configured as the working or protection interface in an APS group.
Precautions
To successfully establish PGP negotiation, ensure that the command configuration is the same on both ends in dual-device APS scenarios.
